title: Moominvalley In November published 1971
content:
Does anyone have any ideas on the title font? Apologies for the low resolution image but this is the only picture I could find for the ’71 edition. Note: (corners seem slightly rounded and lines aren’t always dead straight).

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [014030715X-0-large.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005528/http:/typophile.com/files/014030715X-0-large.jpg) | 12.17 KB |

 [‹ Heavy sans (similar to Rhode black condensed)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005528/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40656 "Go to previous forum topic") [The name of this rounded "disco" font (has a definite 70s feel to it) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005528/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40675 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bob_Mack

comments.content:
If you don’t assume the author’s name is in the same typeface, then [Anzeigen Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005528/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/anzeigen-grotesk-lt/) could be a candidate (otherwise, it has the wrong ’a’). That type should date back to 1971 or earlier, as a pre-digital design.

- Mike Yanega
